Program Advisory Council

Business

Aazam Bhimji

Senior Brand Manager, Dyson

Aazam Bhimji

Senior Brand Manager, Dyson

Aazam Bhimji has over 12 years managing leading consumer brands across a variety of categories and is currently Senior Brand Manager at Dyson. He is responsible for strategic planning, product launches, and marketing within Canada. Upon joining Dyson in 2016, Aazam spearheaded the entry into the air purification category, driving successful growth every year. More recently, he has been leading new innovation launches within the vacuum category, across corded, cordless and robotic formats. Aazam has also played a pivotal role in delivering plans to support the expansion of Dyson’s direct-to-consumer business. Aazam is a leader on Dyson Americas Diversity & Inclusion taskforce, fostering a better sense of inclusion and recognition of the communities Dyson does business in.

Prior to Dyson, Aazam spent six years managing a variety of different brands and products at Reckitt. In his time as Brand Manager on Lysol, he launched the Healthy Habits initiative to introduce hand and surface hygiene education within school curriculum across Canada. He also successfully launched Lysol as a personal hygiene brand. Throughout his experiences, Aazam has not only delivered global, full-funnel campaigns, but also worked with internal and external partners to develop localized communications and campaigns rooted in consumer insights and data.

Aazam has a unique educational background having completed his Bachelors in Biochemistry and Biomedical Sciences and an MBA in Strategic Marketing, both from McMaster University. He is passionate about understanding people, the problems they face, and delivering solutions to improve their daily lives.

Addie Batson

Addie Batson

Addie Batson is an accomplished Customer Success Manager and Consultant with a rich history of driving growth and enhancing customer experiences. With an Honors BA in Communications and Business from York University, Adnahn’s academic foundation laid the groundwork for a stellar career.

Former student leadership roles as the President of Winters College Council and Student Director at the York Federation of Students underscore Addie’s knack for effective collaboration and community leadership.

With a strong track record spanning over 6 years, Adnahn has lent expertise to high-profile organizations including Uber, Clearco, Shopify, Bird, and the DMZ. Addie’s strategic approach centers on cultivating robust customer success journeys, facilitating lasting growth, and fostering unwavering customer loyalty.

Addie looks forward to channeling insights and experience to advance institutional initiatives at his Alma Mata.

Alex Naumov

Alex Naumov

Alex Naumov is an accomplished professional with a strong background in the technology industry, specifically in the field of Software as a Service (SaaS). Passionate about customer success, Alex has been making significant contributions in this area for the past 7 years.

Currently serving as the Senior Director of Customer Success at Vidyard, Alex has played a pivotal role in fostering long-term partnerships through developing tailored approaches to enhance customer experiences and drive business value.

His dedication to customer success and keen ability to navigate the complexities of the industry have allowed him to take on leadership roles in the larger CS community. A highlight of this effort includes his role as a mentor within the Catalyst coaching program.

In his personal life, Alex’s days are filled as a father to 3 energetic boys ages 7, 7, and 9 (that’s right, twins!). They keep him busy with a variety of sports, a love of Lego & Harry Potter, and lots of hijinks.

Andre Plaut

Founder, Human Machine

Andrée Laforge

CHRP, SWP (Strategic Workforce Planner)

Andrée Laforge

CHRP, SWP (Strategic Workforce Planner)

Andrée Laforge holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering and an MBA from Laval University in Quebec City. She has more than 25 years experiences in management position in different organizations. She holds the position of VP Employee Experience and Product Manager at SYNTELL since 2011. She has been involved in several workforce analytics project in SME and large enterprises. She has built a reputation of experts in Workforce analytics in the province of Quebec and she is a frequent guest speaker and lecturer as well as author of several articles and publication on the subject. She is passionate about business intelligence, key performance indicators and human capital. She runs a blog called “Mesurer le capital humain”. In 2018, she was nominated to the “Top 100 HR analytics influencers.”

Anick Fortin-Cousens

CIPP/C, Vice President Of Privacy, Ceridian

Anick Fortin-Cousens

CIPP/C, Vice President Of Privacy, Ceridian

Anick Fortin-Cousens is Vice President of Privacy at Ceridian, where she leads a team responsible for the company’s global privacy policies and programs, and advises the business on a broad range of initiatives and products. Prior to this, she led IBM Corporation’s Privacy Office, and served as Chief Privacy Officer for Canada, Asia Pacific, Latin America and Middle East and Africa.

For 20 years, Anick has worked with public policy makers and other stakeholders across the globe to achieve privacy frameworks that are contemporary, practical and support trusted information flows. She holds law degrees in civil and common law (J.D., LL.L.) from the University of Ottawa (Canada) and an undergraduate degree in journalism. She currently sits on the IAPP Canadian Advisory Board.

Learn more about Anick here.

Arjun Asokakumar

Director of Data Science for the enterprise People Analytics practice, RBC

Arjun is the Director of Data Science for the enterprise People Analytics practice at RBC. In this role, he leads a team of data scientists tackling the bank’s most important people-related challenges through advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI. Arjun is a certified HR leader (CHRL) and brings 14 years of experience in the field. His previous roles include leading a People Analytics practice at BMO, Capacity, and Workforce planning in technology consulting and various other people operations functions.

Brian Weiner

Vice President and Head of Product, Visa Canada

Brian Weiner

Vice President and Head of Product, Visa Canada

Brian Weiner is the Vice President and Head of Product for Visa Canada. His organization is responsible for the development and rollout of Visa’s full Canadian product suite, including its credit, debit, and prepaid products, as well as its expanding array of digital products and capabilities, transit solutions, open banking and real-time payments initiatives. Brian also plays an active role in providing guidance and oversight to Visa’s interchange function, and support to its communications and government engagement functions as well.

Brian has been an active member of Visa’s leadership team since 2010, a decade that is widely viewed as one of the most dynamic and transformational times in the history of the industry in Canada. Through that time, Brian has helped to shape the country’s secular shift to electronic payments, making Canada one of the most cashless economies in the world. He has been recognized for his work as a global winner of Visa’s Go Beyond program and as a finalist for the North America Leadership Award.

Looking ahead, Brian and his team are focused on re-imagining the future of payments in collaboration with many partners across the payments ecosystem in Canada and around the world.

Brian was the founder of Visa Canada’s Let’s Make a Difference committee which promotes community involvement, and he recently served as the Chair of Visa’s Diversity and Inclusion Committee.  In addition, Brian is a global faculty member of Visa University where he has taught courses on Inclusive Leadership to hundreds of colleagues throughout North America and beyond. In recognition of his work promoting the advancement of women, Brian was chosen to represent Visa at a global women’s conference in 2020. He’s also been involved in the community as a Board member of both the Leo Baeck Day School and Jewish Family and Child Services, an Honorary Chair of the Rexall OneWalk to Conquer Cancer benefitting the Princess Margaret Hospital, and he had the pleasure of working as a Big Brother.

Brian has been in the Canadian financial services industry since 1997. He holds an MBA (Accounting) from the Schulich School of Business, a Bachelor of Commerce (Economics) from Carleton University, and he has completed executive courses at Harvard, Cambridge, and INSEAD. Prior to Visa, Brian worked at TD Bank, PricewaterhouseCoopers, and IBM.

Carla Spina

Carla Spina

Carla Spina is a dedicated and experienced human resources professional with over 20 years of experience. She is currently the AVP HR Business Partner at CAA Club Group (CCG), where she oversees employee relations, labour relations, talent acquisition, talent management and organizational design. She has been with CCG for over 17 years, having held many progressive roles in pension and benefits, HRIS management and HR consulting. Prior to CCG she worked at OnX and Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee. Outside of work, she is very passionate about her family and is an advocate for working professionals to find harmony between their career and personal life.

Carla holds a Bachelor of Sociology from McMaster University. She has completed the Post Graduate Program – Human Resources at Humber College, the Masters Certificate in Leading Business Excellence at Schulich School of Business, York University, and the Certified Achieve Global Trainer – Leadership and Teamwork Queen’s Mental Health@Work Leadership Certificate.

Cindy Bush

M.Ed. Chief Human Resources Officer, TMX Group

Cindy Bush

M.Ed. Chief Human Resources Officer, TMX Group

Cindy Bush is Chief Human Resources Officer at TMX Group, responsible for leading all aspects of TMX’s Human Resources function in support of the Company’s corporate objectives, including strategy development and execution, workplace culture, performance management, and talent development and acquisition. Ms. Bush joined the Company in December 2020, after more than 25 years of international experience in human resources, talent strategies and culture transformation.

Most recently, Cindy served as Chief Human Resources Officer at Cineplex and had previously held leadership roles at companies ranging in size from 30 to 100,000 employees, including Foresters Financial, OMERS, and CIBC. In 2008, she authored “Project Managing Change: Practical Tools and Techniques to Make Change Happen,” a global best-seller published by Financial Times Business Enterprises. Ms. Bush holds a Bachelor of Journalism from Carleton University and a Masters of Education from the University of Toronto.

Cindy Zarnett

CHRL. Founder, Squaredots

Cindy Zarnett

CHRL. Founder, Squaredots

Cindy is a dynamic and innovative Senior Human Resources Leader who believes in building and developing workplaces that work. She is the Founder of squaredots, a boutique HR solution providing project-based virtual HR expertise to businesses that directly influence their culture, engagement, productivity and results.

With over 25 years of experience, Cindy’s expertise includes people, performance, recruitment, strategy, leadership, analytics, operations, change, talent, training and policies.

Cindy believes in building and developing a stronger HR community. She is the Vice-Chair, HRPA Registration Committee, Team Leader, HRPA York Region Career Management & Community Engagement (CMCE) Committee. She is also a committee member for the HRPA Experience Assessment Committee (EAC) and Seneca College Program Advisory Committee (PAC) for Human Resources Management programs. Cindy is also a Mentor with Seneca’s Human Resources Mentorship Program.

Dezi Singh

Vice President, Labour Relations and Human Resources, Maple Leaf Foods Inc

Dezi Singh

Vice President, Labour Relations and Human Resources, Maple Leaf Foods Inc

Dezi Singh is currently the Vice President of Labour Relations and Human Resources at Maple Leaf Foods. He received his honours Bachelor of Business Administration degree from the Schulich School of Business at York University in 2006, followed by his Masters degree in Industrial Relations from Queen’s University in 2007. Since then, Dezi has held a number of esteemed positions in the field of labour relations, in large federal and provincial organizations. He has focused on developing labour strategies and collective bargaining, as well as alternative dispute resolution. More specifically, Dezi has created and delivered training with regard to maintaining a positive workplace, health and safety in the workplace, and interest based negotiations. In his free time, Dezi developed and taught a course in negotiations and has been an adjunct professor at York University since 2017.

Julie holds a degree from the University of Toronto, a Certified Human Resources Executive designation from the Human Resources Professional Association, and is certified by the Institute of Corporate Directors as an ICD.D.

Nicole Cressman

Nicole Cressman

Nicole Cressman leads a team of success managers in Financial Services at Microsoft. She has spent almost 20 years working in success roles at both technology and consulting firms and is passionate about the business impact that this position can drive. After taking a degree in Environmental Studies, she found her way into technical recruiting and received great internal training on technology and account management. Years later, after working closely with the CEO of Workbrain to hire his executive leadership positions, he asked her to fulfill the new “customer success” role for the organization, seeing a need to have someone to manage their Fortune 500 customers post sales to ensure they were receiving value from their investment. This was a pivotal moment in her career and she found her way into a career that valued problem solving, active listening, empathy and multi-tasking!

Twenty years later, Nicole remains excited about success management in organizations, and the ability these roles have to partner with the account team to deliver ROI, build critical “trusted advisor” relationships with customers, and earn a seat at the table with business leaders to help drive their strategic objectives.

Tara Lenaghan

Tina Gardiner

Manager, Risk Management Services, The Regional Municipality of York

Tina Gardiner

Manager, Risk Management Services, The Regional Municipality of York

Tina Gardiner is the Manager, Risk Management Services for The Regional Municipality of York, one of Canada’s fastest growing municipalities, and has accumulated over 30 years experience in risk and insurance with various corporations. During her career with York Region Tina has successfully built the Risk Management Services (RMS) unit, from the ground up, incorporating an enterprise risk management approach. Today this unit of claims and risk management professionals has a respected advisory role within the Region.

Continuing education is important to Tina having been a lifelong learner herself. After graduating with her Biology degree (BSc) from Wilfrid Laurier University she went on to complete her Chartered Insurance Professional designation (CIP) from the Insurance Institute of Canada, Canadian Risk Management designation (CRM) from University of Toronto, a Masters Certificate in Municipal Leadership from the Schulich School of Business at York University, Excellence Canada Certificate in Process Improvement Management and York Region’s own Executive Leadership Program. Tina has been an instructing insurance and risk management courses in a formal and non-formal setting since 2005.

Currently serving in her second year as a Director on the Risk and Insurance Management (RIMS) Board, Tina has been an active participant in RIMS at the Chapter level thorough ORIMS, serving several terms as President, and nationally through the RIMS Canada Council serving as Chair. Tina was humbled and honoured to receive the industry’s 2010 Don Stuart Award for Excellence in Risk Management. Tina is also an active member in the Society of Professional Insurance Administrators of Ontario (SPIAO).

Tina likes bringing people together through networking, shared experiences and as a thought leader. She is the co-founder and co- chair of two municipal risk management committees in Ontario; and has served as Chair of a Canadian on-line municipal risk management forum. Risk Management is a passion for Tina, and she loves to talk about anything risk and insurance related….. especially with rising risk and insurance professionals.

Peter Kosmala

CIPP/US, Founder and Principal – PRIVĀT, LLC

Peter Kosmala

CIPP/US, Founder and Principal – PRIVĀT, LLC

Peter is a recognized thought leader in information privacy with 20 years of international experience as a former marketer, technologist, lobbyist and association leader and as a current consultant, educator and keynote speaker.

Peter helped grow the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) from a professional community to the world’s largest privacy association as its first Assistant Director and then as Vice President. He led the creation of the first professional certification in privacy, the IAPP’s Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) in 2004 and launched the CIPP-Canada (CIPP/C) in 2006. Today, over 30,000 professionals globally hold one or more of the CIPP credentials which certify knowledge in privacy laws, standards and practices.

Peter helped to establish the Canadian office of the IAPP and the Canada Privacy Symposium, the flagship annual event held in Toronto since 2006. He has worked closely with practitioners, policy makers and regulators from around the world on privacy matters. Peter’s roots are in digital media at WIRED magazine and Hotwired, one of the very first Web publishing sites. He also served as the first managing director of the Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) and led the expansion of the “Your Ad Choices” consumer privacy preference program.

Peter has served in leadership roles at technology companies CMGI and dataxu (now Roku), trade associations the 4A’s, DAA and the NAI and ad agencies Wells Rich Greene BDDP and MVBMS Partners/EURO RSCG. He has represented industry in policy working groups and technical standards bodies such as the Trustworthy Accountability Group (TAG) and the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Presently, Peter advises clients on the digital media marketplace and the evolving regulatory environment for information privacy.

Vice President Clinical Operations, Novum Pharmaceutical Research Services

Netal has over 16 years of progressive experience in the Clinical Research and Pharmaceutical domains. Netal is presently the Vice President of Clinical Operations for Novum Pharmaceutical Research Services, one of the world’s leading Contract Research Organizations. Previously, Netal held senior roles in medical services, clinical trials management, scientific and regulatory affairs and operations with multinational organizations that include Lambda Therapeutic Research where he served as the Director and then Vice President of Operations, and Intas Pharmaceuticals where he held the position of Senior Executive, Medical Services.

Netal brings research expertise in the design and management of early and late phase clinical research studies globally in various therapeutic areas including oncology, psychiatry, gastro-enterology, diabetes, and skin diseases. He has extensive regulatory interaction experience with the major regulatory authorities such as USFDA, Health Canada, MHRA, ANSM, and SCC.

Netal is a Doctor of Medicine (Pharmacology) and holds a Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) degree from M S University in India. He is a Certified Clinical Research Professional (CCRP) with the Society of Clinical Research Associates (SOCRA).

Nicole Campbell, HBSc, CCRP

Associate Director, Clinical Trial Leader, EMD Serono

Nicole Campbell, HBSc, CCRP

Associate Director, Clinical Trial Leader, EMD Serono

Nicole has almost 20 years of Clinical Research experience working with several industry leaders in drug and vaccine development including Eli Lilly, PAREXEL and currently as an Associate Director and Clinical Trial Leader with EMD Serono Research & Development Institute Inc. In her experience in the multi-national pharmaceutical/biotech industry, Nicole has gained significant experience in managing programs and studies in Phase I through IV in therapeutic areas that include oncology, immunology, endocrinology, men’s and women’s health, central nervous system (CNS), infectious disease and vaccines.

Starting as a Local Study Manager in Canada managing Phase II and III studies, Nicole progressed through various roles and responsibilities which led to relocating to Geneva, Switzerland managing early development studies. Upon returning to Canada, Nicole further diversified her experience by joining Sanofi-Aventis, working on vaccine studies in Toronto. Over the last 10 years, Nicole has managed a number of programs with a focus on budgeting and procurement within a Clinical Trial Program environment.

Nicole obtained an Honours Bachelor of Science in Biology from The University of Western Ontario and a Certificate in Clinical Research from Humber College.

Senior Director, Research Operations and Therapeutic Innovation, Ontario Institute for Cancer Research

Robert V. Campos, PhD

Senior Director, Research Operations and Therapeutic Innovation, Ontario Institute for Cancer Research

Rob has practised Research Administration for over 25 years, presently as the Senior Director, Research Operations and Therapeutic Innovation with the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR), a collaborative, not-for-profit research institute focused on accelerating the translation of new cancer research discoveries to patients around the world. Since joining OICR in 2012, Rob has held leadership positions in Research Operations, Therapeutic Innovation, Genome Technologies, and Commercialization.

Previously, Rob worked at the Eli Lilly and Company headquarters in Indiana for 13 years and at Lilly’s Canadian affiliate for 4 years in various functional disciplines including clinical operations, strategy, governance, portfolio management, and research operations roles in preclinical and early clinical development. Rob provided strategic and operational leadership in medicinal chemistry, discovery-phase biotechnology and drug development, and across multiple therapeutic areas including oncology, endocrine, inflammation and neuroscience.

Rob completed his Bachelor of Science and Doctorate degrees in Physiology at the University of British Columbia. He continued with his post-doctoral training at the Banting and Best Diabetes Centre at the University of Toronto in Molecular Endocrinology. Robert also holds six sigma black belt certification.

Kam has sat on the Board of Directors for the Ontario Association for Family Mediation and participated on the Application Review Committee to assess new applicants for AccFM designation. Kam is a recipient of Helen Pugliese Award for the promotion of peace and harmony in the community, presented by The Community Justice Alternative (CJA) Durham Region.

Kavita Bhagat

B.A., LL.B., ACC.FM

Kavita Bhagat

B.A., LL.B., ACC.FM

Kavita practices exclusively in the area of family law as pertains to mediating, negotiating, arbitrating and litigating residential arrangements, child and spousal support, property division and the preparation of domestic contracts. She is a Certified Specialist in Family Law, accredited Family Mediator, Arbitrator, Parenting Coordinator and former Panel Lawyer for the Office of the Children’s Lawyer. Kavita has worked closely with victims of abuse, facilitated by her fluency in five languages.

Kim Goldstein

BSW, MSW, RSW, AccFM, AccIM

Kim is a Registered Social Worker with a Master of Social Work from Wilfrid Laurier University.  She is an Accredited Family Mediator and Intergenerational Mediator with the Ontario Association for Family Mediation (OAFM).  With over 25 years of experience in conflict resolution, mediation, counselling and assessments, Kim has worked with people from across the lifespan from children to elders.  She also works with individuals, parents and families helping them address personal challenges, change and conflict in their lives.

Kim brings expertise in high conflict family mediation, family dynamics, parent-child relations and mental health.  She is a long-serving roster member of AXIS Family Mediation Inc. and Peel Family Mediation Services, where she serves as a Mediator and Intern Supervisor.  In her private practice, Kim provides services as an Intergenerational Mediator, Designated Capacity Assessor and Voice of the Child Practitioner.  Kim is passionate about the best interests and well-being of children and sits on the Clinical Panel of the Office of the Children’s Lawyer.

Lynn Catzman

B.A., B.Ed., M.A., C. Med.

Lynn Catzman

B.A., B.Ed., M.A., C. Med.

Lynn Catzman brings over 20 years of experience in mediation and alternative dispute resolution.  As a Chartered Mediator with the ADR Institute of Canada, Lynn conducts mediations for civil matters assigned by the Attorney General’s Ontario Mandatory Mediation Program as well as through her private practice including estate, education, employment, insurance and wrongful dismissal.  She is on rosters for the Ministry of Health/Long Term Care, two Ontario professional colleges, and is on the panel of mediators for the ADR Institute of Ontario and the ADR Institute of Canada.

 

Lynn began her mediation career in community-based mediation, where she mediated a variety of cases including court referrals.  In 2005, she was presented with the Ontario Volunteer Service Award from the Ministry of Citizenship and Immigration for her work in the community. Since 2002, Lynn has trained and coached all levels of ADR and has facilitated mediation workshops in Canada, Australia, Ireland, Trinidad and Tobago and Barbados.

BA (Hons), Q.MED, ACC.FM

Mary Chakasim

Mary is Omushkego Cree, and a member of Attawapiskat First Nation from Moosonee. She is dedicated to consensus building and is transitioning her legal practice to family mediation exclusively.

Maurice Ford

MSc., MES., Q.Med., OCT., WFA., RP., Psy.D (c)

Maurice Ford

MSc., MES., Q.Med., OCT., WFA., RP., Psy.D (c)

Maurice is a Qualified Mediator and Registered Psychotherapist in good standing with the College of Registered Psychotherapists of Ontario. He is also the Founder of AM Mediation and specializes in mediating disputes in employment law, personal injury, contracts, and human rights. He is a member of Workplace Fairness International and is certified to provide services to the Government of Canada for mediation and mental health counselling.

Maurice has had a dynamic and varied career, which has led to his current work as a Mediator and Psychotherapist. He began his career as a Probation and Parole Officer, where he quickly learned that dispute resolution often achieves more desirable outcomes when compared to combative approaches and a calm and neutral approach is the most effective strategy in resolving disputes. Following his work in criminal justice, Maurice worked for the Human Rights Commission as a Human Rights Investigator and Mediator for several years. Subsequently, he worked with the Ministry of Attorney General tasked with making difficult treatment decisions about long-term care and life support decisions that involve society’s most vulnerable populations.

Maurice is a rostered member of the Ontario Mandatory Mediation Program, Superior Court of Justice, as well as an Instructor for the Lawyer as Negotiator Program at Osgoode Hall Law School. He is currently pursuing a Doctor of Psychology (PsyD) degree from California Southern University.

Michael Maynard

BA (Law), LLB, Q.Med, P.I., WFA

Michael Maynard

BA (Law), LLB, Q.Med, P.I., WFA

Michael is a mediator, investigator and facilitator with ADR Chambers who has mediated more than 2,000 private and public disputes. His areas of expertise include administrative, civil, code of conduct/disciplinary matters, contract, insurance (including personal injury and Statutory Accident Benefits matters), landlord/tenant, and workplace disputes.

Michael is the ADR Chambers Integrity Commissioner for Niagara Region, the Town of Grimsby, the Toronto District School Board, and the Durham District School Board. He is also an investigator for the ADR Chambers Ombuds Office for banking and municipal matters. Michael has investigated a variety of workplace disputes involving discrimination, harassment, and bullying claims, and is on the approved list for workplace investigations with the Ontario Public Service. He is also a Workplace Restoration Facilitator.

In addition to having developed and taught Alternative Dispute Resolution courses at Durham College, Michael co-founded the Campus Mediation Services, which provides a dispute resolution process for the campus community. He is a co-author of the textbook Choices in Approaching Conflict: Principles and Practice of Dispute Resolution, 2nd ed. (Emond Publishing, 2019).

Michael McCrory

BA, BCL/LLB

Michael McCrory

BA, BCL/LLB

Michael was appointed Vice-Chair of the Ontario Labour Relations Board in 2019 and also runs a bilingual private labour arbitration and mediation practice where he specializes in labour and employment disputes. Michael has over thirty years experience working on both sides of the table in a number of operational positions, including as a lawyer and as a labour relations professional.

Michael is a graduate of McGill University’s Faculty of Law. Upon being called to the Bar in 2004, Michael began his legal career working in the Labour & Employment Law practice groups of two law firms before becoming in-house counsel with Air Canada, with a particular emphasis on labour-related litigation. He has extensive experience in the airline industry with international airlines in Canada, the United States and Asia, where he served as Head of Employee Relations.  In 2014, Michael was appointed Director, Labour Relations, Air Canada, and in 2018, Director, Labour Arbitration.

Mitchell Rose

LL.B., C.Med, Q.Arb

Mitchell Rose

LL.B., C.Med, Q.Arb

Mitchell Rose is the Principal of Mitchell Rose Professional Corporation (Rose Dispute Resolution and Mitchell Rose Law) in the Greater Toronto Area. A graduate of Osgoode Hall Law School, Mitch was called to the Ontario Bar in 1995 and has since attained the designations of Chartered Mediator and Qualified Arbitrator.

Mitch was a civil litigator throughout most of his legal career. As his mediation practice grew, he ceased practising traditional court and tribunal-based litigation and became a Settlement Counsel (ADR Lawyer) who negotiates and attends mediations and pre-trials as an advocate.  Mitch offers dispute resolution services — mediation, mediation-arbitration, and arbitration — for a variety of civil disputes, including commercial, employment, estates, and real estate.

A former Chair of the Alternative Dispute Resolution Section of the Ontario Bar Association (2020-21), Mitch is a member of the Canadian Academy of Distinguished Neutrals, a Distinguished Fellow of the International Academy of Mediators, and a former member of the Board of Directors of the ADR Institute of Ontario. He is a frequent writer and speaker on ADR-related topics, and he enjoys mentoring and instructing newer members of the legal and ADR professions.  In this regard, Mitch has a long-standing connection to York University: he guest-judged first-year law student moots and coached law student mediators for many years, and he has chaired and spoken at ADR-related programs for Osgoode PD.

Nalini Jugnundan

Raheena Lalani Dahya

LL.B., LL.M., FDRP Med

Raheena Lalani Dahya

LL.B., LL.M., FDRP Med

Raheena is a family law, community, and civil mediator, with experience as a family and child protection lawyer. Her mediation practice integrates a variety of approaches and modalities, such as interests-based, trauma-informed, transformational, psychotherapeutic, high-conflict, community-informed, and complex disputes mediation. She is a regular contributor to continuing education programs in the Alternative Dispute Resolution field; and serves on ADR teaching and coaching teams at various institutions.

As a Professor of Alternative Dispute Resolution at Humber College, Raheena’s academic focus is on the application of principles of Interpersonal Neurobiology to the practice of mediation in general, and specifically to supporting human vulnerability in the context of conflict. She also researches themes at the intersection of artificial intelligence, law, and culture, exploring how the conflict resolution field can adapt and thrive in an ever-evolving algorithmic society.

Raheena takes on a variety of voluntary roles within the community. At present, she is serving as a Board Director for the Family Dispute Resolution Institute of Ontario, including founding and co-chairing the Family Violence Section, and co-chairing the Diversity and Inclusion Committee; and is a member-at-large of the Executive Board for the Ontario Bar Association’s Alternative Dispute Resolution Section. She also serves as a volunteer roster mediator with St. Stephen’s Community House.

Sharon Naipaul

B.R.S., J.D.

Sharon Naipaul

B.R.S., J.D.

Sharon (she/her) is a Mediator, Trainer and Consultant at Strategic Workplace: Equity and Conflict Resolution Solutions. She provides mediation, workplace restoration, workplace assessments, training and other supports to a wide range of workplaces. Sharon has 15 years of experience in labour, employment and human rights as both a practicing lawyer and a mediator. She has mediated close to a thousand disputes, including many multi-party and extremely complex, high-profile cases.

Sharon gained her expertise in workplace issues (labour, employment, and human rights) when she began her career in private practice for a prominent union-side labour law firm in Toronto. Following that, she went in-house at a major public service union as a litigator. She then spent many years as a Senior Mediator at the Ontario Labour Relations Board. After working as a mediator, Sharon returned to private legal practice as a Workplace Investigator, conducting numerous complex investigations, as well as mediations, workplace restorations, and workplace assessments.

Sharon’s goal is to incorporate anti-oppressive, anti-racist, anti-hierarchical, and trauma-informed principles into all of the work that she does. She is deeply passionate about the power that mediation and mediation-related processes have to transform workplaces and conflicts, and the as-yet untapped potential of mediation if applied in a wider variety of contexts.

Sharon was called to the Bar of Ontario in 2011 after obtaining her J.D. from Western Law in 2010. She interned at the International Labour Organization in Geneva and led both the Diversity Committee and Labour Law Society.  Sharon holds an Executive Certificate in Conflict Management, and Certificates in Transformative Mediation and Advanced Workplace Restoration. She is a designated Workplace Fairness Assessor, a member in good standing with the Law Society of Ontario, and a member of the Ontario Bar Association (Labour and Employment and ADR sections), CBA, ADRIO and ADRIC. Sharon is also the Co-Founder of the Women’s Indo-Caribbean Entrepreneurial Group.

William Cornet
